Name: Assertion
Definition: A "logical expression specifying a program state that must exist or a set of conditions that program variables must satisfy at a particular point during program execution" (IEEE, 2017, p. 30)
Note(s): "Types include input assertion, loop assertion, output assertion" (IEEE, 2017, p. 30)

Name: Branch
Definition: "A transfer of control to an entry point of the test item" or "from any node to any other node in the control flow model" (IEEE, 2021, p. 23) that may involve "a set[] of program statements … [being] selected for execution" (2017, p. 51)
Synonym(s): Arc (implied by IEEE, 2021, p. 24; Kam, 2008, p. 42), Link, Edge (implied by IEEE, 2021, p. 24), Decision Point (implied by 2017, p. 51)

Name: Call Graph
Definition: A "diagram that identifies the modules in a system or computer program and shows which modules call one another" (IEEE, 2017, p. 56)

Name: Cause-Effect Graph
Definition: A "logical network[] that map[s] a set of causes to a set of effects by systematically exploring the possible combinations of input conditions" (Washizaki, 2024, p. 5-11; similar in Hamburg and Mogyorodi, 2024) and "can optionally model syntactic and semantic constraints over [these] relationships" (IEEE, 2021, p. 19)

Name: Classification Tree
Definition: "A tree diagram representing test data domains of a test object" (Hamburg and Mogyorodi, 2024) as "a decomposition hierarchy" (IEEE, 2017, p. 485; OG PMBOK) using "distinct classifications (relevant test aspects) and classes (input values)" (IEEE, 2022, p. 3; 2021, p. 2)

Name: Commercial Off-the-Shelf
Definition: "A type of product developed in an identical format for a large number of customers in the general market" (Hamburg and Mogyorodi, 2024)

Name: Common Gateway Interface
Definition: An "object[] that execute[s] on the server … initiated by [a] forms-based user interaction[] on the browser" (Gerrard, 2000b, p. 13)
Note(s): "The most common mechanism used to implement functionality on web sites" (Gerrard, 2000b, p. 11), including business logic, order or payment processing, and security checking (p. 13)

Name: (Software) Component
Definition: A discrete entity, either structurally (IEEE, 2017, p. 419; OG ISO/IEC, 2015), functionally, or logically (IEEE, 2017, p. 419), "within a system considered at a particular level of analysis" (ISO/IEC, 2023b; IEEE, 2017, p. 419; OG ISO/IEC, 2015) "that can be tested in isolation" (Hamburg and Mogyorodi, 2024); "the individual subprograms or components, a subsystem, or a composition of … components" (Washizaki, 2024, p. 5-6) or even an entire system (IEEE, 2017, p. 419; OG ISO/IEC, 2016)
Synonym(s): Module, Unit (Hamburg and Mogyorodi, 2024; often in IEEE, 2017, p. 82)
Note(s): "The terms module, component, and unit [sic] are often used interchangeably or defined to be subelements of one another in different ways depending upon the context" with no standardized relationship (IEEE, 2017, p. 82); for example, "components differ from classical modules for being re-used in different contexts independently of their development" (Baresi and Pezzè, 2006, p. 107). It seems like this could apply to the testing of both modules and specific functions

Name: Composite Keyword
Definition: A "keyword[] … constructed based on other keywords" (IEEE, 2016, p. 3)

Name: Computation Data Use
Definition: A "use of the value of a variable in any type of statement" (IEEE, 2021, p. 2; 2017, p. 83; OG 2015), "as an input to the computation of the definition of any variable or of an output" (2021, p. 27; similar in van Vliet, 2000, p. 424), or not as a P-use; e.g., the use of a variable in a computation or I/O statement (van Vliet, 2000, p. 424)

Name: Condition
Definition: A "Boolean expression containing no Boolean operators" (IEEE, 2021, p. 2)

Name: Data Analysis
Definition: The "systematic investigation of the data and their flow in a real or planned system" (IEEE, 2017, p. 114)

Name: Decision
Definition: A "point[] in the test item where two or more possible outcomes (and hence sub-paths) may be taken by the control flow" (IEEE, 2021, p. 24; OG BS 7925-2; OG Myers 1979)
Note(s): "Typical[ly] … used for simple selections (e.g. if-then-else …), to decide when to exit loops (e.g. while-loop …) and in case (switch) statements (e.g. case-1-2-3-…-N …)" (IEEE, 2021, p. 24; OG BS 7925-2; OG Myers 1979)

Name: Decision Table
Definition: A "tabular representation of decision rules [or logical relationships (IEEE, 2021, p. 18)] between causes and effects" (2022, p. 3) or of "sets of conditions and the actions resulting from them" (2017, p. 123; similar in 2021; p. 18)

Name: (Data/Variable) Definition
Definition: A "statement where a variable is assigned a value" (IEEE, 2021, p. 3; 2017, p. 115; OG 2015; similar in 2012, p. 27); "possibly … the same value as it had before" (2021, p. 27)

Name: (Data) Definition-Use Pair
Definition: A "data definition and subsequent predicate or computational data use, where the data use uses the value defined in the data definition" (IEEE, 2021, p. 3; 2017, pp. 115, 125; OG 2015; similar in Hamburg and Mogyorodi, 2024)

Name: Document Object Model (DOM) (Bajammal and Mesbah, 2018, p. 193)
Definition: "A cross-platform and language-independent convention for representing and interacting with objects in HTML, XHTML and XML documents" (Doğan et al., 2014, p. 179)

Name: (Test) Driver
Definition: A "software module used to invoke a module under test and, often, provide test inputs, control and monitor execution, and report test results" (IEEE, 2017, p. 468)

Name: Equivalence Partition
Definition: A "subset of the range of values of a variable, or set of variables, within a test item or at its interfaces" (IEEE, 2013, p. 3) such as its inputs and outputs (2021, p. 11) "that are expected to be treated similarly by the test item" (2022, p. 4; 2021, p. 4; similar on p. 10)
Note(s): An "equivalence partition[] … can overlap … [or] be a subset of another" (IEEE, 2021, p. 11)

Name: Extended Entry (Decision) Table
Definition: A decision table where the "conditions consist of multiple values rather than simple Booleans" (IEEE, 2021, p. 18) or "the conditions and actions are generally described but are incomplete" (2017, p. 175; OG ISO, 1984)

Name: Functional Unit
Definition: An "entity … capable of accomplishing a specified purpose" (IEEE, 2017, p. 196) that is "logically separable" (IEEE, 2017, p. 489) and "not subdivided" (IEEE, 2017, p. 489; OG ISO/IEC, 2012)

Name: (Test) Harness
Definition: "Scaffolding code written for the purpose of exercising lower level code when the higher-level code that will ultimately exercise it is not yet available" (IEEE, 2017, p. 469); "a collection of stubs and drivers needed to execute a test suite" (Hamburg and Mogyorodi, 2024)

Name: High-level Keyword
Definition: A "keyword that covers complex activities that may be composed from other keywords and is used by domain experts" (IEEE, 2016, p. 3); "a meaningful name is used to identify the keyword", and it "may require a set of input parameters" (p. 4)

Name: Invariant
Definition: An "assertion that is always true for a specified segment or at a specified point of a computer program" (IEEE, 2017, p. 240)

Name: Keyword
Definition: "One or more words [including "at least one verb"] used as a reference to a specific set of actions intended to be performed during" testing (IEEE, 2022, p. 5; 2016, p. 3); should be unambiguous and "comprehensive enough so that most, if not all, required test cases can be entirely composed of these keywords" (p. 4)
Synonym(s): Action Word (implied by IEEE, 2016, p. 6; Hamburg and Mogyorodi, 2024)

Name: Low-level Keyword
Definition: A "keyword that covers only one or very few simple actions and is not composed from other keywords" (IEEE, 2016, p. 3)

Name: Markov Chain
Definition: "A discrete-time stochastic process model with a memoryless property" meaning that a given state transition "is not related to the history of transitions" (Kam, 2008, p. 21)

Name: Metamorphic Relation
Definition: A "description of how changes to the test inputs for a test case affect the expected outputs" (IEEE, 2022, p. 6; 2021, p. 4; similar on pp. 21-22 and in Hamburg and Mogyorodi, 2024)
Note(s): "Will not always … [provide] an exact value" for "the expected result for the follow-up test case", and "can often be used to derive multiple follow-up test cases" (IEEE, 2021, p. 22). Should be "reviewed and agreed by [sic] relevant stakeholders, such as business users" (p. 22). May be uncovered using regression analysis? See ISO 29119-11

Name: Minimization
Definition: The process of "reduc[ing] the number of test cases required to cover valid test coverage items" (IEEE, 2021, p. 10)

Name: Mixed Entry Table
Definition: A "decision table whose stub consists of rows in which limited and extended entries are written" (IEEE, 2017, p. 278; OG ISO, 1984)

Name: Multiple-hit Decision Table
Definition: A "decision table where at least one set of conditions will be satisfied by more than one rule" (IEEE, 2017, p. 285; OG ISO, 1984)

Name: Operational Profile
Definition: "An actual or predicted pattern of use of the component or system" (Hamburg and Mogyorodi, 2024)

Name: (Test) Oracle
Definition: A "source of information for determining whether a test has passed or failed" (IEEE, 2022, p. 13)

Name: Parameter-Value Pair
Definition: The "combination of a test item parameter with a value assigned to that parameter" (IEEE, 2022, p. 7; 2021, p. 5; 2017, p. 311; OG 2015)
Synonym(s): P-V Pair (IEEE, 2022, p. 7; 2021, pp. 5, 15; used in Hamburg and Mogyorodi, 2024)
Note(s): "Used as a test condition and coverage item in combinatorial test design techniques" (IEEE, 2022, p. 7; 2021, p. 5; 2017, p. 311; OG 2015)

Name: Path
Definition: "A sequence of [consecutive (Hamburg and Mogyorodi, 2024)] instructions that are performed in the execution of a computer program" (IEEE, 2017, p. 316) or test item (IEEE, 2021, p. 5; 2017, p. 316; OG IEEE 2015)
Synonym(s): Control Flow Path (Hamburg and Mogyorodi, 2024; implied by Washizaki, 2024, p. 5-13)

Name: Path Analysis
Definition: The "analysis of a computer program to identify all possible paths through the program, to detect incomplete paths, or to discover portions of the program that are not on any path" (IEEE, 2017, p. 316)

Name: Predicate
Definition: A "logical expression which evaluates to TRUE or FALSE to direct the execution path in code" (IEEE, 2021, p. 5; similar in 2017, p. 331; OG 2015)

Name: Predicate Data Use
Definition: A "data use associated with the decision outcome of the predicate portion of a decision statement" (IEEE, 2021, p. 5; 2017, p. 332; OG 2015; similar in 2021, p. 27); e.g., the use of a variable in a conditional (van Vliet, 2000, p. 424) like "a while-loop or if-then-else" (IEEE, 2021, p. 27)

Name: Regression Analysis
Definition: "An analytic technique where a series of input variables are examined in relation to their corresponding output results in order to develop a mathematical or statistical relationship" (IEEE, 2017, p. 372)

Name: Requirement
Definition: A "condition or capability that must be met or possessed by a system … to satisfy an agreement, standard, specification, or other formally imposed documents [sic]" (IEEE, 2017, p. 380)

Name: Requirements Analysis
Definition: The "process of studying and refining system, hardware, or software requirements" (IEEE, 2017, p. 381)

Name: Risk Analysis
Definition: "The process of finding, recognizing and describing risks" (Hamburg and Mogyorodi, 2024), including "examining … [them] for probability of occurrence, potential loss, and potential risk-handling strategies" (IEEE, 2017, p. 390)
Note(s): Hamburg and Mogyorodi (2024) break this down into "identification" and "assessment". See ISO 31000

Name: Separation Logic Specification
Definition: The specification of "dynamically-allocated linked data structures" that only "concentrates on the resources relevant to its correct operation" (Berdine et al., 2006, p. 115)
Synonym(s): Assertion (Lahiri et al., 2013, p. 345), Specification, with context (Berdine et al., 2006; likely Chalin et al., 2006)

Name: Single-hit Decision Table
Definition: A "decision table where any set of conditions will be satisfied by one, and only one, rule" (IEEE, 2017, p. 415; OG ISO, 1984)

Name: State (Transition) Diagram
Definition: A diagram that maps out the logic flow from the user's perspective by showing every possible unique state, the conditions that take the program between states, and the conditions and outputs when a state is entered or exited (Patton, 2006, p. 81-82)

Name: State Transition
Definition: A "change from one state to another … or the same state" (IEEE, 2017, p. 484; OG ISO/IEC, 1995)
Note(s): "An individual transition may be constrained by an event guard" (IEEE, 2021, p. 19)

Name: (Test) Stub
Definition: A "skeletal or special-purpose implementation of a software module, used to develop or test a module that calls or is otherwise dependent on it" (IEEE, 2017, p. 444)

Name: Sub-path
Definition: A "path that is part of a larger path" (IEEE, 2021, p. 5; 2017, p. 444; OG 2015)

Name: System
Definition: "An interacting combination of elements to accomplish a defined objective" that includes "hardware, software, firmware, people, information, techniques, facilities, services, and other support elements" (Washizaki, 2024, p. 1-5; OG INCOSE; Firesmith, 2015, pp. 21-23 also implies that hardware, software, and system testing are distinct)
Note(s): Only the software component of "system" is in scope of this research; sometimes this is explicit in its definition (Sakamoto et al., 2013, pp. 343-344) or done in cases where "the software is itself the system of interest, and hardware and support system are regarded as the platform or infrastructure" (Washizaki, 2024, p. 1-5)

Name: Template Variable
Definition: A "variable[ or] expression[] for embedding in [an] HTML template[]" (Sakamoto et al., 2013, p. 344)

Name: Test Case
Definition: "A set of preconditions, inputs (including actions, where applicable), and expected results [from a test oracle (Sakamoto et al., 2013, p. 344)], [sic] developed to determine whether or not the covered part of the test item has been implemented correctly" (IEEE, 2021, p. vii)

Name: Test Code
Definition: "An executable program including test cases" (Sakamoto et al., 2013, p. 344)

Name: Test Coverage Items
Definition: "Attributes of the test model that can be covered during testing" (IEEE, 2021, p. vii)

Name: Test Execution Engine
Definition: A "tool implemented in software and sometimes in hardware that can manipulate the test item to execute test cases" (IEEE, 2016, p. 3)

Name: Test(ing) Framework
Definition: An "environment that facilitates testing" (IEEE, 2016, p. 4), potentially "by writing test code" (Sakamoto et al., 2013, p. 344)
Note(s): Examples: JUnit (Sakamoto et al., 2013, p. 344), COBRA (Preuße et al., 2012, p. 2)

Name: Test Hook
Definition: A "customized software interface that enables automated testing of a test object" (Hamburg and Mogyorodi, 2024)

Name: Test Interface
Definition: An "interface to the test item used to stimulate the test item, to get responses (e.g. actual results), or both", including "GUI, API … [and] SOA interfaces" (IEEE, 2016, p. 4)

Name: Test Item
Definition: A "work product to be tested" (IEEE, 2022, p. 12; 2021, p. 6)
Synonym(s): Test Object (IEEE, 2022, p. 12; 2021, p. 6), System Under Test (SUT) (get source(s)), Object Under Test (OUT) (Firesmith, 2015, p. 11), Implementation Under Test (IUT) (Jard et al., 1999, p. 26)

Name: Test Model
Definition: A representation of the "testable aspects of a test item, such as a function, transaction, feature, quality attribute, or structural element identified as a basis for testing" that "reflects the required test completion criterion" (IEEE, 2021, p. vii) and "test coverage items" (pp. 9-10) and "allows the testing to be focused on particular characteristics or qualities" (p. 6)
Note(s): Is "typically … the basis for several test coverage items" (IEEE, 2021, p. vii)

Name: Test Oracle
Definition: "Determines whether the program works as expected by observing the program state" (Sakamoto et al., 2013, p. 344)

Name: Test Script
Definition: A "test procedure specification for manual or automated testing" (IEEE, 2017, p. 472; OG 2013) or "sequence of instructions for the execution of a test" (Hamburg and Mogyorodi, 2024)

Name: Unified Model Language (UML) (Kam, 2008, p. 11)
Definition: "A de facto standard modeling language that models the system, validates the user requirements … and is widely accepted by industry" (Kam, 2008, p. 12)

Name: (Software) Unit
Definition: An "atomic-level software component of the software architecture that can be subjected to stand-alone testing" (Washizaki, 2024, p. 10-3; IEEE, 2017, p. 428; OG ISO/IEC, 2016; similar in Hamburg and Mogyorodi, 2024) that is "separately compilable" (IEEE, 2017, p. 428; OG ISO/IEC, 2008), "logically separable" (IEEE, 2017, p. 489), and "not subdivided" (IEEE, 2017, p. 489; OG ISO/IEC, 2012)
Synonym(s): Component, Module (Hamburg and Mogyorodi, 2024; often in IEEE, 2017, p. 82)
Note(s): "The terms module, component, and unit [sic] are often used interchangeably or defined to be subelements of one another in different ways depending upon the context" with no standardized relationship (IEEE, 2017, p. 82)

Name: (Data) Use
Definition: An "executable statement where the value of a variable is accessed" (IEEE, 2021, p. 3; 2017, p. 120; OG 2015) or "an occurrence of a variable in which the variable is not given a new value" (2021, p. 27)
